com.parrot.arsdk.arsal

Class ARNativeData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.parrot.arsdk.arsal.ARNativeData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ARCommand

    public class ARNativeData
extends Object
    Root class for all C data that may pass through different libs of AR.SDK

    AR.SDK Is mainly implemented in C, and thus libs often use C structures to hold data.
    This is a wrapper class onto these kind of data, so java can pass them around libs without copy into JVM memory space.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ARNativeData()
      Default size constructor This constructor allocate a ARNativeData with the default capacity
      ARNativeData(ARNativeData data)
      Copy constructor
      This constructor creates a new ARNativeData with a capacity
      equal to the original objects data size
      ARNativeData(ARNativeData data, int capacity)
      Copy constructor, with specified allocation size
      This constructor creates a new ARNativeData with a capacity
      equal to the greatest value between the specified capacity and the original
      object data size
      ARNativeData(int size)
      Generic constructor
      This constructor allocate a ARNativeData with the given capacity
      ARNativeData(long data, int dataSize)
      Copy constructor (from native)
      This constructor creates a new ARNativeData with a capacity
      equal to the original data size

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispose()
      Marks a native data as unused (so C-allocated memory can be freed)
      A disposed data is marked as invalid

      • ARNativeData

        public ARNativeData(ARNativeData data,
            int capacity)
        Copy constructor, with specified allocation size
        This constructor creates a new ARNativeData with a capacity
        equal to the greatest value between the specified capacity and the original
        object data size
        Parameters:
        data - The original ARNativeData to copy
        capacity - The minimum capacity in bytes for this ARNativeData

      • setUsedSize

        public boolean setUsedSize(int size)
        Sets the used size of the ARNativeData
        Parameters:
        size - New used size of the command
        Returns:
        true if the size was set
        false if the size was invalid (bigger than capacity) or if the ARNativeData is invalid

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Gets the capacity of the ARNativeData
        This function returns 0 (no capacity) if the data is not valid
        Returns:
        Capacity of the native data buffer

      • getData

        public long getData()
        Gets the C data pointer (equivalent C type : uint8_t *)
        This function returns 0 (C-NULL) if the data is not valid (i.e. disposed or uninitialized)
        Returns:
        Native data pointer

      • getDataSize

        public int getDataSize()
        Get the C data size (in bytes)
        This function returns 0 (no data) if the data is not valid
        Returns:
        Size of the native data

      • getByteData

        public byte[] getByteData()
        Gets a byte array which is a copy of the C native data
        This function allow Java code to access (but not modify) the content of the ARNativeData
        This function creates a new byte [], and thus should not be called in a loop
        Returns:
        A Java copy of the native data (byte equivalent)

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Marks a native data as unused (so C-allocated memory can be freed)
        A disposed data is marked as invalid

      • ensureCapacityIsAtLeast

        public boolean ensureCapacityIsAtLeast(int minimumCapacity)
        Ensures the capacity is at least the minimum capacity set.
        Parameters:
        minimumCapacity - minimum capacity to ensure
        Returns:
        true if the capacity is at least minimumCapacity
        false if the reallocation of the buffer with at least the minimum capacity has failed
